page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN MALVERN WELLS
page.content: The main{Paddington-Hereford railway {line}emerges from the tunnel through the Hills in the extreme north west of the area. Evidence of the{Ashchurch- {Great Malvern branch line}(closed in 1952) still remains. Of the old Wells station only the stationmasters house still exists. Roads skirt the Hills: to the east the{Malvern-Ledbury A road climbs steeply to British Camp. The scenic{Jubilee Drive}on the west provides views of Herefordshire. Several{toll cottages}have been demolished but one on the A4104 above Little Malvern survives, although unoccupied. Recently the state of {minor roads}and the provision of {public transport}has deteriorated. Some of the network of designated {footpaths}is becoming overgrown through disuse, although overuse of other hill paths has caused erosion.
